network.name: network
network.description: the name of the network that should be used

token.name: token
token.description: the name of the token that should be used

network.name: network
network.description: the name of the network that should be used

token.name: token
token.description: the name of the token that should be used

network.name: network
network.description: the name of the network that should be used

token.name: token
token.description: the name of the token that should be used

host.name: host
host.description: the host that should be used to expose the RPC

port.name: port
port.description: the port that should be used to expose the RPC

allowRemote.name: allowRemote
allowRemote.description: allow remote connections which are filtered by a whitelist

whitelist.name: whitelist
whitelist.description: a comma separated list of IPs that can access the RPC

peer.name: peer
peer.description: the peer you want to use for communication, defaults to random network peers

maxLatency.name: maxLatency
maxLatency.description: the maximum allowed latency of a peer, defaults to 300ms

peerPort.name: peerPort
peerPort.description: the public API port of the peer you want to use to load seeds

examples:
Run a JSON-RPC with a pm2 daemon
$ exchange-json-rpc start --network=mainnet
